Thanks. VERY HELPFUL!!!!

There is one correction to making here: for his accomplishments, Napoleon was actually treated well during his last days in St. Helena. This was because the English did respect, albeit their history. However, Napoleon wanted to discredit them, and in his letters home, complained that he was treated badly. The truth was that he was allowed his own entourage, as well as horses, servants, and a house that was enlarged at his request (among many other things.) [Source: Alan Schom]
